intro: Macronema greenei, commonly known as the Greene's macronema, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes the carrot and parsley family, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in desert or arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. The leaves are usually finely divided and can be used in traditional herbal medicine.
